verses.kjv: Wherefore, holy brethren, partakers of the heavenly calling, consider the Apostle and High Priest of our profession, Christ Jesus;
verses.web: Therefore, holy brothers, partakers of a heavenly calling, consider the Apostle and High Priest of our confession: Jesus,
verses.ct: So then, my holy brothers and sisters — you who share in this heavenly calling — fix your thoughts on Jesus, the Apostle and High Priest we confess.

verses.kjv: Who was faithful to him that appointed him, as also Moses was faithful in all his house.
verses.web: who was faithful to him who appointed him, as also Moses was in all his house.
verses.ct: He was faithful to God who appointed him, just as Moses was faithful in all of God's house.

verses.kjv: For this man was counted worthy of more glory than Moses, inasmuch as he who hath builded the house hath more honour than the house.
verses.web: For he has been counted worthy of more glory than Moses, because he who built the house has more honor than the house.
verses.ct: But Jesus deserves far greater glory than Moses, just as the person who builds a house receives more honor than the house itself.

verses.kjv: For every house is builded by some man; but he that built all things is God.
verses.web: For every house is built by someone; but he who built all things is God.
verses.ct: Every house is built by someone, but God is the one who built everything.

verses.kjv: And Moses verily was faithful in all his house, as a servant, for a testimony of those things which were to be spoken after;
verses.web: Moses indeed was faithful in all his house as a servant, for a testimony of those things which were afterward to be spoken,
verses.ct: Moses was indeed faithful as a servant in all of God's house, and his life pointed ahead to the things God would reveal later.

verses.kjv: But Christ as a son over his own house; whose house are we, if we hold fast the confidence and the rejoicing of the hope firm unto the end.
verses.web: but Christ is faithful as a Son over his house. We are his house, if we hold fast our confidence and the glorying of our hope firm to the end.
verses.ct: But Christ is faithful as a Son over God's house. And we are his house — if we hold firmly to our confidence and the hope we celebrate, all the way to the end.

verses.kjv: Wherefore (as the Holy Ghost saith, To day if ye will hear his voice,
verses.web: Therefore, even as the Holy Spirit says, “Today if you will hear his voice,
verses.ct: That's why the Holy Spirit says: "Today, if you hear his voice,

verses.kjv: Harden not your hearts, as in the provocation, in the day of temptation in the wilderness:
verses.web: don’t harden your hearts, as in the rebellion, like as in the day of the trial in the wilderness,
verses.ct: don't harden your hearts the way your ancestors did during the rebellion, on that day of testing in the wilderness,

verses.kjv: When your fathers tempted me, proved me, and saw my works forty years.
verses.web: where your fathers tested me and tried me, and saw my deeds for forty years.
verses.ct: where your fathers tested me and pushed me, even though they watched what I did for 40 years.

verses.kjv: Wherefore I was grieved with that generation, and said, They do alway err in their heart; and they have not known my ways.
verses.web: Therefore I was displeased with that generation, and said, ‘They always err in their heart, but they didn’t know my ways.’
verses.ct: That's why I was angry with that generation and said, 'Their hearts always go the wrong way, and they have never understood how I work.'

verses.kjv: So I sware in my wrath, They shall not enter into my rest.)
verses.web: As I swore in my wrath, ‘They will not enter into my rest.’ ”
verses.ct: So in my anger I made an oath: 'They will never enter my rest.'"

verses.kjv: Take heed, brethren, lest there be in any of you an evil heart of unbelief, in departing from the living God.
verses.web: Beware, brothers, lest perhaps there might be in any one of you an evil heart of unbelief, in falling away from the living God;
verses.ct: Be careful, brothers and sisters, that none of you develops an evil, unbelieving heart that turns away from the living God.

verses.kjv: But exhort one another daily, while it is called To day; lest any of you be hardened through the deceitfulness of sin.
verses.web: but exhort one another day by day, so long as it is called “today”, lest any one of you be hardened by the deceitfulness of sin.
verses.ct: Instead, encourage each other every day — while it's still called "today" — so that none of you becomes hardened by sin's tricks.

verses.kjv: For we are made partakers of Christ, if we hold the beginning of our confidence stedfast unto the end;
verses.web: For we have become partakers of Christ, if we hold the beginning of our confidence firm to the end,
verses.ct: We share in all that Christ offers, but only if we hold on to the confidence we had at the beginning and keep it firm until the very end.

verses.kjv: While it is said, To day if ye will hear his voice, harden not your hearts, as in the provocation.
verses.web: while it is said, “Today if you will hear his voice, don’t harden your hearts, as in the rebellion.”
verses.ct: As it says: "Today, if you hear his voice, don't harden your hearts the way they did during the rebellion."

verses.kjv: For some, when they had heard, did provoke: howbeit not all that came out of Egypt by Moses.
verses.web: For who, when they heard, rebelled? Wasn’t it all those who came out of Egypt led by Moses?
verses.ct: Now, who heard God and still rebelled? Wasn't it all the people Moses led out of Egypt?

verses.kjv: But with whom was he grieved forty years? was it not with them that had sinned, whose carcases fell in the wilderness?
verses.web: With whom was he displeased forty years? Wasn’t it with those who sinned, whose bodies fell in the wilderness?
verses.ct: And who made God angry for 40 years? Wasn't it the ones who sinned — the ones whose bodies dropped dead in the wilderness?

verses.kjv: And to whom sware he that they should not enter into his rest, but to them that believed not?
verses.web: To whom did he swear that they wouldn’t enter into his rest, but to those who were disobedient?
verses.ct: And when God swore that certain people would never enter his rest, who was he talking about? Those who refused to believe him.

verses.kjv: So we see that they could not enter in because of unbelief.
verses.web: We see that they weren’t able to enter in because of unbelief.
verses.ct: So we can see plainly: they couldn't enter his rest because of their unbelief.
